column3: Random question would it make sense for libsecp256k1 a submodule (http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Submodules) of bitcoin core?\nI've never used them but it seems to me that this could be a case where they make sense.\n
There is a long debate between users of submodules and of subtrees. I'd\nrather not repeat it here :)\n
Oh, I see. But I assume in principle any of those would serve...shirt or t-shirt? Though choice, better go out naked.\n

We _are_ using git subtree (for libsecp256k1 and for leveldb). This is a
pull request with a merge made by git subtree. There is a script in contrib
or devtools that can verify that the subdirectory matches the history of
the external repo.
Oh I see, great. Never mind then, thanks for explaining.\n
Let's use a RAII approach here. Otherwise, there will be a leak when control flow leaves the function through an exception.\n
